content.description: This is a beautiful roof climb that everyone should try. Starts low just out of the cave in a slot for your hands. Moves right to the corner then up and left.
content.location: Located a quick hike down past the outhouses. Follow the trail that goes by the foundation of the old bathroom house, it should cross a stream then go down the hill a bit. Follow the trail past the first boulder with a crack climb and slab, should be right after.

content.description:
A fun line to play on while others project Tome's. Squat start under the leftside of the large roof with both hands on a large rail. Pull onto the wall and make a hard move up to a decent sloping pinch, from here make another hard move up to a nice incut edge before crossing up to a nice pinch and traversing out right on the large shelf-like feature to topout as for Tome's Roof.

 The crux of the problem is figuring out the body positioning and where to put the feet in order to avoid dabbing the rock just left of this climb.

 Seems a bit improbable!
content.protection: 4 pads. A spike just right of the start could prove dangerous if one was to fall on the first two moves.
content.location: The left side of the large roof.

content.description: Start in two letterbox slots about 1 foot apart. Put a right heel-toe cam in the flat jug on Tome's Roof, then do a long, powerful lock off to a very small left hand mini-pinch. Put as much weight in the heel toe cam as possible and lock off to one of two crimps in the middle of the face. Tick tack through a few more decent crimps until you are matched on the slopey ledge. Finish up and right as for Tome's Roof.

pathTokens: Boulders Behind the Main Parking Lot/Visitor Center
